MemoryInfobox.description: 'Using her great skills of observation and deduction, Kassandra searched for the ciphers to help her unlock the secrets of the mysterious Chimera's Breath.'
MemoryInfobox.appearance: 'Assassin's Creed: Odyssey' – 'Legacy of the First Blade: Shadow Heritage'

General_Description: '''Tides of War''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s genetic memories, relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: Kassandra spoke to the [[Gyras|engineer]]'s [[Parmys|wife]] about the [[Chimera's Breath]] weapon plans.
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra spoke to Parmys.
*'''Parmys:''' ''I saw you talking to my husband. I can help.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''The engineer's wife. What do you know about the weapon plans?''
*'''Parmys:''' ''My husband scattered code books around [[Achaia]]. Some are amongst the [[Phila|Tempest]]'s fleet and others are in the [[Patrai Military Shipyard|shipyard]]. With them, you'll learn how to build and install the weapon. Then you can end the Tempest and avenge my husband.''
<tabber>
|-|Your husband will be avenged.=
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I'll end the Tempest with or without your husband's weapon. Either way, he'll be avenged.''
|-|I will do my best.=
*'''Kassandra:''' ''The Tempest's fleet is powerful. Avenging your husband will be difficult. But I'll try.''
</tabber>

*'''Parmys:''' ''He would be happy to hear that.''
(Asked "Where are the ships?")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''There plenty of ships in Achaia. What should I look for?''
*'''Parmys:''' ''The Tempest's ships patrolling the harbor will be a good place to start.''
(Asked "Where is the shipyard?")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''You said some of the code books are in the shipyard. Where is it?''
*'''Parmys:''' ''The Patrai Military Shipyard is the one at the edge of the city.''
(Leave – "I'll get started.")
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I'll find those code books.''
[[File:ACOD Tides of War 2.png|thumb|250px|Kassandra finding the book beneath the stairs on the ship]]
Kassandra travelled to the Patrai Military Shipyard. [[Ikaros]] called out one of the code books on a prototype [[trireme]].
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Found it!''
Kassandra infiltrated the shipyard and retrieved the book.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''This must be one of the code books the engineer's wife mentioned. I can't understand any of this, but maybe [[Barnabas]] can.''
Ikaros spied another on a column beneath the roof of the warehouse.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I see it.''
[[File:ACOD Tides of War 3.png|thumb|250px|Kassandra recovering the book beneath the roof]]
She climbed to the book and retrieved it.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Another code book. Good.''
Kassandra left the shipyard and travelled to the [[Adrestia]]. She departed Patrai and sailed after the ships carrying the code books. Ikaros identified them from the air.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''That's what I'm looking for.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''There it is!''
[[File:ACOD Tides of War 4.png|thumb|250px|The ''Adrestia'' chasing down the ships containing the book]]
The books were aboard [[Sparta]]n patrol ships.  Kassandra ordered the crew to open fire on them.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Let's destroy the patrols before they call for reinforcements.''
She destroyed a Spartan ship and recovered a code book.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''A code book. I'll give this to Barnabas.''
Kassandra chased down the other ship and recovered the last book.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''That should be the last of them.''
After some time, the Chimera's Breath was successfully installed at the bow of the Adrestia.
Section_Outcome: Kassandra found and collected all code books about the Chimera's Breath weapon.
Section_References:
*''[[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]]'' – ''[[Legacy of the First Blade: Shadow Heritage]]''

[[Category:Memories of Kassandra]]
